data.sampled: The answer is no. When comparing two things (in this case the weight of bricks and dust particles) you can only make an accurate assessment when both items are the same. For example, you could accurately say that 10 kg of bricks is lighter than 10 kg of bricks. Or you could say that 10 kg of bricks are exactly the same weight as 10 kg of bricks. Unfortunately, we can't accurately compare the weight of different things, as things can have widely differing weights to begin with. Hopefully this clears things up and answers your question.
